description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5mjeg","text":"Note that this version of the protocl was adopted to V14 chemistry of ONT.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"be6el","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b86ho","text":"This RCA-NGS were optimized for an NGS machine, MinION. These methods do not require nucleic acid amplification with virus-specific PCR primers, physical viral particle enrichment, and RACE. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8qi3r","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9pfre","text":"These methods enable whole RNA viral genome sequencing by combining the following techniques:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bfk31","text":" 1) removal of unwanted DNA and RNA other than the RNA viral genome by nuclease treatment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fedg0","text":" 2) the terminal of viral genome sequence determination by barcoded linkers ligation","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"93bvr","text":" 3) Amplification of the viral genomic cDNA using an isothermal DNA amplification technique, such as rolling circle amplification (RCA). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fmnjl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"76kvv","text":"This method can be exploited to determine any whole RNA viral genomes (i.e., single-stranded, double-stranded, positive-stranded, negative-stranded, non-segmented or multi-segmented genomes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
